workflow.name: Create AI diary entries from LINE photos with OpenAI Vision and Google Drive
workflow.description:
**Overview**

This workflow turns photos sent to a LINE bot into tiny AI-generated diary entries and saves everything neatly in Google Drive. Each time a user sends an image, the workflow creates a timestamped photo file and a matching text file with a short diary sentence, stored inside a year/month folder structure (KidsDiary/YYYY/MM). It‚Äôs a simple way to keep a lightweight visual diary for kids or daily life without manual typing. 

LINE Photo to AI Diary with Goo‚Ä¶

**Who this is for**

Parents who want to archive kids‚Äô photos with a short daily comment

People who often send photos to LINE and want them auto-organized in Drive

Anyone who prefers a low-friction, ‚Äútake a photo and forget‚Äù style diary

**How it works**

Trigger: A LINE Webhook receives an image message from the user.

Extract metadata: The workflow extracts the messageId and replyToken.

Download image: It calls the LINE content API to fetch the image as binary.

AI diary text: OpenAI Vision generates a one-sentence, diary-style caption (about 50 Japanese characters).

Folder structure: A KidsDiary/YYYY/MM folder is created (or reused) in Google Drive.

Save files: The photo is saved as YYYY-MM-DD_HHmmss.jpg and the diary text as YYYY-MM-DD_HHmmss_diary.txt in the same folder.

Confirm on LINE: The bot replies to the user that the photo and diary have been saved.

**How to set up**

Connect your LINE Messaging API credentials in the HTTP Request nodes.

Connect your Google Drive credential in the Google Drive nodes and choose a root folder.

Make sure the webhook URL is correctly registered in the LINE Developers console.

**Customization ideas**

Change the AI prompt to adjust tone (e.g., more playful, more sentimental).

Localize the diary language or add an English translation.

Add a second branch to post the saved diary entry to Slack, Notion, or email.

Organize Google Drive folders by child‚Äôs name instead of only by date.

workflow.name: LINE Photo to AI Diary with Google Drive Storage

parameters.content:
## Step 1 ‚Äì Receive photo

This group handles the incoming image from LINE:

- **LINE Webhook** receives the photo message from the user.
- **Extract LINE Message Data** pulls out the `messageId` and `replyToken` from the event payload.
- **Get Image from LINE** calls the LINE content API and downloads the binary image file.

## Step 2 ‚Äì Create diary text & folder path

These nodes generate the AI diary sentence and prepare where it will be stored:

- **OpenAI Vision ‚Äì Generate Diary** analyzes the photo and returns a short, Japanese diary-style sentence (about 50 characters).
- **Prepare Folder Path** builds a `KidsDiary/YYYY/MM` path based on the current date.
- **Create Folder Structure** ensures the Google Drive folder exists before any files are uploaded.

## Step 3 ‚Äì Prepare diary file for Google Drive

Here we combine data and create the text file that will sit next to the photo:

- **Merge** joins together the original image metadata and the AI diary sentence.
- **Convert to File** turns the diary text into a `.txt` file.
- **Upload Photo to diary„ÄÄnew** uploads the `_diary.txt` file to Google Drive so it lives next to the photo in the same folder.

## Step 4 ‚Äì Save original photo & confirm to user

Finally, the workflow stores the original image and lets the user know everything worked:

- **Upload Photo to Drive** uploads the original photo into the `KidsDiary/YYYY/MM` folder with a timestamped filename.
- **Reply to LINE** sends a confirmation message so the user knows their photo and diary entry were saved successfully.

## LINE Photo to AI Diary with Google Drive Storage

This workflow turns every photo sent to your LINE bot into a tiny AI-generated diary entry, plus neatly named image and text files in Google Drive. Each run saves the original photo and a matching `_diary.txt` file inside a `KidsDiary/YYYY/MM` folder, so you can easily look back on each day later.

### Who this is for
- Parents who want an easy kids' photo diary
- Anyone who sends photos to LINE and wants them auto-archived
- People who prefer a ‚Äútake a photo and forget‚Äù style journal

### How it works
1. **Step 1 ‚Äì Receive photo** ‚Äì LINE Webhook receives the image, Extract LINE Message Data pulls out `messageId` and `replyToken`, and Get Image from LINE downloads the binary photo via the LINE content API.
2. **Step 2 ‚Äì Create diary text & folder path** ‚Äì OpenAI Vision ‚Äì Generate Diary creates a short Japanese diary-style sentence (around 50 characters), while Prepare Folder Path and Create Folder Structure build a `KidsDiary/YYYY/MM` folder path in Google Drive.
3. **Step 3 ‚Äì Prepare files for Drive** ‚Äì Merge and Convert to File combine the outputs and create a `.txt` file for the diary sentence so it can be stored alongside the image.
4. **Step 4 ‚Äì Save & confirm** ‚Äì Upload Photo to Drive and Upload Photo to diary„ÄÄnew store the photo and text file in the same folder, then Reply to LINE sends a confirmation message back to the user.
